justification: “The Balloon Analogue Risk Task (BART) is a commonly employed task measuring decision-making under uncertain-risk.”
“The current study utilized the financial domain score of the DOSPERT… participants indicated how risky they perceived the situation (i.e., Perceived Risk).”

“Utilizing self-report measures of perceived risk, and separately expected benefit of risk, the current study tests whether either of these different processes contribute to differences in risk-taking tendencies.”
“The Defeatist Performance Scale (DPS) is a 15-item measure of defeatist beliefs, or negative appraisals about one's ability to complete goal-directed tasks.”
“The Snaith-Hamilton Pleasure Scale (SHAPS) is a 14-item scale measuring hedonic tone, or one’s ability to experience pleasure.”
“General intelligence (IQ) was assessed via the Wechsler Abbreviated Scale of Intelligence (WASI) two sub-test form.”
“Letter number sequencing … were also assessed as measures of working memory.”
“Digit symbol … assessed as measures of … processing speed.”

measured_by: Par4 computational model applied to BART data
justification: “Utilizing the Par4 model, decision-making was parsed into computationally derived subprocesses… identified less Risk Propensity (γ) in SZ relative to CP.”
